page.title: 04North Shoreham
page.content: FARMING-THE DOWNS On Tuesday 18th June a group of us wentto survey the farming of the Downs. Having walked along the Upper Shoreham Road we crossed the dual carriageway of the A27 and started looking at the fields. We saw some grazing land that was being used by horses.In the next field we saw barley. We noticed that most of the fields had chalk soil.Then we saw a giant field of broad beans.The hills were bumpy and so was our track. Another main crop we saw was wheat. We looked at the difference between wheat and barley,and found that barley had hairs and wheat did not. As we walked back we looked from a high hill and saw the fields of wheat and barley that we had passed.{
